summary: Bath is a historic city in Somerset, England, famous for its Roman-built baths. With a population of over 94,000, it's known for its beautiful architecture and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The city grew around natural hot springs, becoming a popular spa town in the 1700s. Georgian-era buildings like the Royal Crescent attract many visitors. Bath has a rich history, from Roman times to the present, with museums, parks, and sports teams. It's also home to two universities and is a popular tourist destination.
title: Bath, Somerset
